The broccoli bites where horrible and a waste (dry and not even really any broccoli and cheese filling at all. The fries where dry too... I don't drink but I don't think I would even go back for drunk dive bar food.
Awesome wings and sauces. Small place that is in desperate need of a makeover. Other bar food is good. The staff is friendly and food is always quick.

It's a little hole-in-the-wall bar, the wings are so so at best,the service was sort of lacking, it's definitely a locals place, it's a dive bar, so I didn't expect it to be real clean and it lived up to that expectation of course

This is a hole in the wall place but their wings are the best in town. Talked this place up to my co-worker who has never been. He had high expectations and love it. If you need your wing fix this is the best place.

Damn that shit was good!! This is the best bad food we've had. Divey little neighborhood type bar with no ambience and we didn't care. Service  was great, server knew her shit. We ordered classic burger with fries, Philly cheesy steak with potato salad, and Honey Gold wings.  Cheeseburger cooked only one way, well done.  But it was delicious and juicy. French fries cooked on the well done side like I asked, crispy and delicious. We order half Philly cheesesteak and the size was perfect and big enough. So good. We got pasta salad by mistake and was told to keep it and I'm so glad they did. It was some kind of Mediterranean style with rotini pasta, pepperoncini peppers, feta cheese. So good. The potato salad was like old fashioned homemade with a slightly sweet taste. It was fantastic too. The wings were sauced perfectly and juicy and cooked the way i like em. Blue cheese on the side was creamy and chunky. Everything tasted hot and fresh. Go in, order a beer or a sweet tea and get some wings and burgers. I'm so mad I'm full, but I took leftovers home and I'm eating that shit later!!

Found this place by accident after pulling over to take a phone call. Didn't expect much based on the appearance of the place but thought I'd have a snack anyway. I didn't try the wings but I did try the fried mushrooms with ranch dipping sauce. They were fantastic, tastes just like grandma's. Came back the next day for another taste.
Always awesome, always welcoming and amazing food. Broccoli cheddar balls are to die for. So hot ranch with anything you own.

This was my first and last visit! I ordered the hosin honey,ginger and so called lemon pepper. This was in fact the worst wings experience. The hosin honey was god awful....it was like eating burnt wings with a bitter after taste. The ginger wings were just as bad.The lemon pepper was missing the lemon and pepper...hints to why I referred to them as so called lemon pepper.   I wish the waitress would have informed me of the presentation of the hosin wings since I mention it was my first time visiting the establishment.I ended up tossing the wings after tasting one of each flavor.   I couldn't believe how awful the favors were. What a waste of $15.00.

I was in town on a work trip and stuck in the suburbs away from downtown Charlotte. My flight got in late and DD Peckers was one of the only places open after 10PM that wasn't closing in the next 30 minutes.  I hate to admit it, but I was not expecting much when I rolled up to this spot. If anything, I was expecting cheap beer and decent wings.  The wings were described as jumbo, and that an order of 10 is usually a good meal. I got 10 wings and a half order of the chili cheese fries.   The chili on the fries was really good. It was chili with beans, which I prefer, but I know it's not everyone's favorite. The fries were pretty tasty with tons of cheese and chili. Definitely eat them with a fork.  The wings were the star, for sure. They were not breaded and they were very crispy, without being over cooked. The sauces were spicy and tangy (I forgot which two flavors I tried, but they were very good). I remember one of the sauces was peppery instead of tasting like tabasco. I really enjoyed that one. It was definitely worth it.  If I'm ever back in town, I'd go back for sure.
Great homemade blue cheese.. Great "hot" wings.. Great spicy onion rings, not heavily breaded and seasoned well!  Staff was quick, efficient and friendly
Wonderful wings. Hot and spicy! Great homemade chips. The wait staff is fun and informative. Excellent, fun time. Love the hot ranch wings.

From the outside, and maybe even when you first walk in, it seems like a total hole in the wall! But don't let that fool you! They are awesome. Great, great food, friendly staff and great prices. My favorites are the mild wings, their cheeseburger and their french fries! My boyfriend says the Oyster Po Boy is the best he's ever had (which surprised us considering we're not near the coast!). And lately, my teenage son keeps asking if we can come back because he loves their bacon cheeseburger! HIGHLY recommend this place!!

We went for wings. The more I ate them the better they got. The waitress was a little slow to get our order and checks when we were done, but we also went late so I'll give her he benifit of the doubt.   Really though, get the wings!

Wings! I am addicted.  Here they have a sauce selection that would embarrass many so-called wing establishments. I opted for the sauce-dip all-in-one... the hot ranch. So good. Just creamy and spicy and delicious. Wings are cooked long enough here to render out some fat and crisp up. Nice direct service as well. Got me in and out for lunch like a champ.

I didn't actually intend to go to DD Peckers Wings.  I was looking for a different restaurant when stumbled across it.  It was on my bookmark list to try, so rather than waste more time looking for the other place, I stopped in there.  I was glad I did.  The place is pretty much a dimly lit dive bar & grille type place.  I ordered some onion rings to start with a and 10 wings with the hot sauce.  My onion rings came out pretty quick.  The rings hand made, hot out of the fryer, with just the right amount of grease.  They were thin with the batter just about falling off and very, very tasty.  They reminded me of the onion rings that my family used to get when we went out to the local fried chicken joint on Sundays as a treat.   I had a little bit of a wait after I finished the rings before my wings came out, but my waitress kept my drink filled.  The wings were a pretty good size and well coated with sauce.  They were steaming hot, temperature wise, and spicy hot flavor wise.  Usually when I order hot it is more like a medium to my palate, but these were truly hot on my spice meter.  The only negative I could find was that they were a little over cooked, but not by much so I couldn't give them 5 stars.  This place is pretty hidden in a strip mall and you'd probably drive right by if you weren't looking for it.  But my recommendation is to look for it and you won't be disappointed.  The price is also very reasonable, $7.50 for 10 wings with a wide range of sauces.  I'm definitely going back there.

The place was average. Wings are ok. Nothing special. They are on the small side. I didn't like the fact that they didn't have Medium as an option. Hot was too much sauce and mild was not enough. This is the ONLY wing place I visited that didn't have Medium. The place is clean. The servers were nice. It is in a low to mid-level plaza that is showing it's age. This place has received accolades, but I can think of a dozen wing places in Charlotte that are better.

This is one of the best places to get wings in Charlotte. I've been wanting to check it out for a while now, but just now got around to it. Wing King Cafe is also frequently mentioned as the best wings in Charlotte. It's hard for me to say which is better since it's been a few years since I've been to Wing King Cafe, but both have amazing wings.   We got the 25 wing sampler with Ginger, Hot Gold, Hot Ranch, Hot Fajita, Garlic Parmesan. All of the flavors were really good and the hot flavors weren't too spicy (to someone who doesn't like really spicy food). The Hot Fajita was definitely the hottest, but was still good to me. It had a strong lime flavor and was my husband's favorite (he loves spicy food). We both agreed the Ginger was the weakest of the flavors we got - it had a teriyaki/ginger seasoning, but didn't have much flavor at all. The charred flavor was good, but I was hoping for a much stronger ginger flavor. The Hot Ranch was a Buffalo Ranch and was pretty good. The Hot Gold was a mustard BBQ with a little kick and the Garlic Parmesan was pretty solid. Overall, there's a ton of options to choose from and I would expect everyone to be able to find something they like.   The service is incredibly fast and friendly. They were happy to provide explanations and recommendations.   We will definitely be coming back next time we want some wings!

Best wings around. Been a while since we had eaten here, yelped to find best wings as well as googled and this came up over and over again.  Perfect example of a dive bar if I have ever seen one. Staff was all super nice, they all appeared to enjoy working there, family like atmosphere, lots of regulars. Ordered the fried pickles, onion rings and the hot ranch wings.  Had the fried pickles before, they do the spears, looooove the spears.. they were good, crunchy, salty right amount of breading. The onion rings, they were sad.. greasy, mushy... a few were crunchy and those were tasty but most were too greasy/mushy to eat. The hot ranch wings.. OMG... I woke up this morning wanting them for breakfast. The wings themselves were super crispy... even with the sauce.. the hot ranch was not hot by my standards but had really good flavor.. BF has eaten there many times, never tired and he was said he had been missing out. I will be eating here again in another week or so for sure.

I sat at this establishment after driving out of my way and it took 5 mins before even getting drink orders. The waitress/bartender literally dropped the drinks down on our table and kept moving. After I motioned several times that we were ready to order I watched our waitress/bartender take several to-go orders, chat it up with other patrons and never once did she come over and take our food order. We waited 30+ mins. before I just walked out my sister stayed but I refused to eat here. People had come and gone that's how long we had been waiting. NEVER AGAIN! And bet your bottom I'll make sure to leave my experience on every website I can find! Absolutely ridiculous!  I get that there were only two servers working but it wasn't terribly busy if she had enough time to do all that other stuff that she couldn't stop 2 mins to take our order.  Update: She told my sister it was a misunderstanding. She thought we weren't ordering anything. That she thought we were waiting on laundry (BULLS***!). Why would I tell you I was trying to pull the menu up on my phone if I wasn't planning on ordering? And in what establishment does a server not come back and ask if you want more to drink or want to order anything even if they aren't sure you plan to order? Try again with someone who might believe that lie!

Food is great, too bad I can't say the same of the employees. Poor customer service!!! Waitress dropped menu on the table. Yes, dropped it didn't fall. Also, gave us someone else's ranch with our order and didn't even apologize. Once you arrive they don't greet you , so sit where ever you would like. Horrible.

Wings were pretty good. I will give them 3 stars. Good size and cooked perfectly. This place does define "dive" so it caused no disappointment as it came as expected.   I got the HOT wings - they were medium to me but tasty. I got the "blazing" sauce on the side and it was not any hotter than the hot sauce. And, it didn't taste like buffalo sauce anymore so I'm glad I ordered the hot wings.

I decided to try this place after hearing so much hype about it.  When we got inside it reminded me of one of my other favorite spots to get wings. Wing King. Menu was similar as well. We went with the Honey hot wings and fries. They tasted just like the wings at Wing King which is a good thing. My only complaint would be the wings could've used more sauce. I will keep this place in my rotation.

Thank you yelp for some of the best wing flavors I've ever tried.   Go with a group of friends and order as many different types as you can. I tried hoisin honey, hot gold, and cajun rub - they were all really delicious. I can't wait to come back here.  Staff is friendly and served us drinks while we wait for our to-go order.  They even gave us napkins when they saw us sneak off a couple wings from the box as we were paying.
They have some of the best wings I've had in the Charlotte area. Would defiantly recommend them to anyone looking for some good wings.

I've gone in twice for take out. Really friendly bar staff!   First time I got 10 wings (5 lemon pepper/5 honey BBQ). The lemon pepper could've used a little more flavor. Tasted a little plain but wasn't all that bad. Honey BBQ was delish with dripping sauce!   Second time I got 5 hoisin honey and 5 Cajun. The hoisin honey tricked me at the beginning! They looked charred. Black. Look at the pic. Although I feel like these might have been a little overcooked on the outside, they hoisin flavor was still present and the honey drizzled over them fixed it. The Cajun was sandblasted with Cajun run. No complaints with that one. Had a really good kick to it.   Side note: I ordered chips and salsa also. Chips were cold and stale. To be fair, I ordered these at around 10pm...  Overall I'd totally come back to taste all the other flavors!!

My favorite wing place in Charlotte this far. The servers are friendly and get to know their regular patrons. If you're not there at 11:30 or before on most days, you may arrive to a packed house. I generally get 5 honey hot and 5 hot honey bbq wings. The flavors sound similar but are different.

Wings A++++ OMG we tried the honey teryaki, ginger, gold, lemon pepper, and hawiann. All were fab. The place itself ok. From what I seen they have a very limited selection of liquor and a small selection beer. Sanitation rating was an 'A' at 90.0 and from what I seen it was clean. It almost looks like a bar with food. We also had the burger, quesadilla, chicken tenders, and fries. Everything was great.

This spot looks like a serious dive, but if you like Chicken, Wings, Apps and Great Food, then this is a must stop! Love the Buff. Chicken Sandwich with homemade bluecheese!! Can't wait to try the Wings. Love this spot!!

YUM! Delicious wings, entertaining trivia host, great prices, super service and fun customers. I used to live around the corner and went here way more often, but even now that I've moved to the clear opposite side of town I still make the trek to visit once and a while.   The location may seem a bit odd at first, it's a strip mall hole-in-the-wall type bar with about 10 four top/3 high top tables and a bar that seats 8 or so, but if you're craving the best bar food THIS. IS. THE. PLACE!  *Favorite thing: Hot Garlic wings dipped in Ranch...or their cafeteria style krinkle cut fries, or their spicy fried pickles. Yeah, it's really just too hard to choose!

If you like dive bars, don't judge books by their  covers, don't mind a cold domestic beer, unpretentious waitstaff and really good wings, this my friend, is the place for you.  Come as you are, park in the raggedy parking lot. Tiny place that is well worn but clean.  Get a bottle of Miller Lite or Ultra and get some wings to share try the Gold, they are excellent.  I'm not saying this is the place to bring out of town friends but there is a reason this it has great reviews.  So the next time you don't feel like putting make up on or doing your hair, give this place a try.
So good! Wings & burgers are the best. Fried pickles & chili cheese fries are awesome too.
In for bowl game. Awesome wings. Great fries. Good beers. Awesome service.  Highly recommend.
This is a really fun dive bar. It's small but has a lot of personality. The wings are killer and they usually have some good deals on drinks. This place is great for what it is
Go for the Hot Garlic wings with Fries to dip in the sauce.  Great sauce, with LOTS of garlic.  Good cold beer as well.

Best wings ever.  Just fantastic.  You may think twice about walking in, but will be glad that you did.  Found a great combination here, parm-garlic with a side of mild sauce is a flavor I can't do without when I go here.  Something on the menu for everyone.  Ample portions, excellent servers!  Do it!

I didn't get to try the food because the initial service was so terrible, impolite, and disrespectful that I left. It's unfortunate to have your restaurant hindered by a rude, unenergetic waitress who appears to want to punch someone within moments of "greeting" them. Doubt I'll try a second time.

Every time I order with the white trash girl named Michelle she gives me an attitude never gives me the right sauce ranch and this last time my wings we cold an no sauce with them except this time my wings were cold she wouldn't make them over so I decided to do this now she always has an attitude with people or color I'm there on a weekly basis so she know
